results.title: The Music album: 'Blue Danube' and 'Romance'

results.title: The Muscle spindle
results.brief_description: This film shows how the electrical impulses produced by movement and tension of a muscle are transmitted to and received from the nervous system. The techniques for isolating a muscle spindle and keeping it alive outside the body are demonstrated.
results.description: This film shows how the electrical impulses produced by movement and tension of a muscle are transmitted to and received from the nervous system. The techniques for isolating a muscle spindle and keeping it alive outside the body are demonstrated.

results.title: The Muppets take Manhattan [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jim Henson, David Lazer and Frank Oz
results.brief_description: Kermit and his Muppet theatrical troupe attempt to stage a musical on Broadway, but are shunted around by unscrupulous producers. In desperation the Muppets each go their own way to make a living but reunite when a young producer discovers their script. Kermit, however, comes down with a case of amnesia and emerges as an agency big shot. Miss Piggy, jealous of Kermit’s friendship with a waitress, karate chops him back to reality and it’s “On with the Show”.

results.title: The Muppet movie
results.creator_credit: Jim Henson, ITC Entertainment and James Frawley
results.brief_description: Kermit the Frog has finally hit the big time and he’s heading for Hollywood. With his fellow Muppets including Miss Piggy, Gonzo, Animal, Fozzie Bear, plus the rest of the Muppet Performers, they encounter real life stars along the way. Kermit begins his journey on a humble bicycle, but as the passengers accumulate along the way his means of transport increases in size. Kermit also has to contend with the slimy Doc Hopper who is eager for Kermit to promote fried frog legs, as well as his strong feelings for Miss Piggy. Features a number of cameos as well as paying homage to several classic films.

results.title: The Munchers: a fable
results.brief_description: Animated clay figures representing teeth, plaque, bacteria, dental floss and the toothbrush present information on nutrition and dental health. The proper type of foods for optimum oral health is also discussed.
